subject: test a method in proxy class associated with a session bean
msgSnippet: Hi, I have junit test case which checks a create user method in a userproxy class which internally invokes a session bean and DAO to actually insert into the
messageBody:
Hi,

I have junit test case which checks a create user method in a
userproxy class which internally invokes a session bean and DAO to
actually insert into the database.The create method returns a
valueobject so in my assert condition I check if valueobject is null.
App Server - Weblogic

public void testcreate() {
try{
IUserValueObject valueobject = null;
valueobject = UserProxy.createUser(getNewValueObject());
assertNotNull(valueobject);
}
catch(Exception e){
System.out.println("ERROR ----" + e);
}
}
public static IUserValueObject getNewValueObject()
{

IUserValueObject newValueObject = new UserValueObject(
new UserPrimaryKey(new Long(300)),
"USR",// usr type
"Anitha",
"matson",
"tester",
"x",
"QA",
"Manager",
"Anitha@...",
"matson"
);

return( newValueObject );
}
this sis the error message i get when i execute the test case

.ERROR! - com.matson.ecs.exception.ProcessingException: Inside
GroupProxy:create(..) - Could not create the GroupServiceSession
Bean.javax.naming.NoInitialContextException: Need to specify class
name in environment or system property, or as an applet parameter,
or in an application resource file: java.naming.factory.i
nitial : Need to specify class name in environment or system
property, or as an applet parameter, or in an application resource
file: java.naming.factory.initial


What is the problem is it in the src code or my test case
